FAQs

If you didn't find the answer to your question, please contact us.
General Registration & onboarding Product & features Support

What is NDC?

NDC(New Distribution Capability) is an XML-based data transmission standard developed by IATA to modernize airline distribution. It enables richer, more personalized offers from airlines and allows travel agencies to access content directly, rather than relying solely on traditional GDS systems.

What is an aggregator?

An aggregator connects multiple airline NDC APIs into a single platform, allowing travel sellers to access, book, and manage offers from various airlines through one integration. This simplifies development and improves efficiency by avoiding separate connections with each airline.

Why should I adopt HaloSync?

HaloSync stands out with a seamless integration experience, end-to-end B2B support through Luna(B2B Portal Service), smart commission and fare control via Albus(Platform Control & Admin), and scalable infrastructure based on the latest NDC standards.

I am a travel agency that also does some B2B business. Can I pass along the NDC content to my B2B clients?

  • You can register your B2B IATA# to integrate with the PolarHub API and access NDC content, or use Luna(B2B Portal Service) separately for offline operations.
  • The integration procedure is identical for both B2C and B2B clients.

If I have two IATAs, can I access and display/control different content based on my different IATAs?

Yes, we provide accounts based on IATA#s. This allows for the sale and management of airline content according to the regional characteristics and business goals associated with each IATA#.

Can I connect to PolarHub and use a different travel agency's IATA credentials? (e.g. If it is a global company with multiple branches or brands.)

  • Yes, we provide accounts based on IATA#s, allowing for control and data access for each individual IATA#.
  • To protect the valuable information of our clients, the registration of another company's IATA# is restricted during the application review process. For more details, please contact us separately.

Do you offer subagent management modules or interfaces so some of my offline branches can view only one part of the service, but not all?

Yes, depending on the permission management of the accounts provided for each IATA#, subagencies can manage only the bookings of the corresponding agency.

Is the booking data from the agency shared with external parties or third parties?

  • We comply with international data protection regulation through both administrative and technical measures. Our system is designed to ensure that we access data for the purpose of providing services, and only with explicit contractual or consent-based authorization.
  • If there is an unavoidable need to provide information to a third party, we will obtain the client’s consent before taking any action.

Will my customer booking data be leaked? Do you follow GDPR/other regulations?

  • Individual client data is physically and logically separated from other client data, and is managed in an encrypted form that is not identifiable outside of our internal systems.
  • We manage personal data in compliance with international privacy regulations, including GDPR. This includes adhering to legally defined retention periods, encrypting data, controlling access permissions, and tracking access history.

How is the contract process conducted?

  • First, a mutual NDA must be signed before finalizing HaloSync contract.
  • Once the contract is finalized, integration with your existing systems will commence. Halo&Co will provide technical support along with an PolarHub API integration development guide to ensure integration is completed as quickly as possible. For detailed integration steps, please refer to Solutions > How HaloSync works.
  • If you prefer to use NDC content without system integration, you can start using NDC content immediately through our Luna(B2B Portal Service). If you're specifically interested in Luna, please contact us separately.

In what format is the PolarHub provided?

After the contract is finalized, integration work with your existing system will proceed. To ensure a swift integration and enable you to start your business as quickly as possible, Halo&Co provides technical support along with an PolarHub API integration development guide.

What do we need to prepare for PolarHub integration?

  • When signing the contract, the travel agency's IATA# and endpoints for both the sandbox and production environments for API integration are required. If you apply through Solutions > Ready to board the future of air travel” we will provide you with detailed integration steps and all necessary information.
  • If you do not have an IATA#, please contact us separately.

How long does it take to integrate with our platform and PolarHub?

  • Integration typically takes 2 months, but may vary based on client needs and situation.
  • For back-office system integation, expect around 3 months.

How complex is the process of integrating the PolarHub into an existing system?

PolarHub API is designed based on the NDC standard to enable easy integration with OTA (Online Travel Agency) systems. Through a single API connection, you can quickly and efficiently access NDC content from multiple airlines, reducing both development time and cost.

Is there a free version available?

A free version is not available at the moment, but we are preparing one and will make it available shortly.

Do you provide demo version to test?

A tenant-specific demo is not currently available. If you would like to request a demo, please contact us separately.

What are they different ways I can integrate to PolarHub?

There are two ways to integrate with PolarHub:
a. API integration through a separate contract with Halo&Co.
b. Integration via the AWS Marketplace.

What features are provided by the platform?

We support features such as instant ticketing, cancellations and refunds, ancillary purchases, and reservation changes. Please note that available functionalities may vary by airline. For details, please refer to Solutions > Our solutions & airline integration matrix.

Do you display all fare types (e.g. branded fares, Private fares, corporate fares)?

Yes, we provide all types of fares. We offer airline-specific branded fares, corporate fares, and special discounted fares.

What ancillaries do you offer?

  • Commonly, baggage and pre-seat reservations are available. There may be additional ancillary services specific to each airline, and we plan to add common services such as in-flight meals, lounge access, and Wi-Fi in the near future.
  • Service availability may differ depending on the airline. Please visit Solution > Our solutions & airline integration matrix for more information.

Can you share and display rich content?

Currently, the utilization and provision of rich content by airlines is not yet active. The provision of rich content is in the preparation stage.

Can I combine NDC content from Halo&Co with my existing GDS content, including features like split search and virtual interlining?

We do not currently offer this. In the future, we plan to provide split search between NDC content and LCC content, as well as virtual interlining.

Do you offer localized payment solutions (e.g. local payment, alipay, kakaopay)? I don't want to pay each airlines seperately, can you consolidate and pay on my behalf?

Currently, we support the use of travel agencies' own payment methods and BSP settlements for airlines that are registered with BSP. In the future, we plan to offer more efficient payment functionalities by utilizing Halo&Co’s own payment method.

How fast is the response times?

HaloSync has implemented Global Network Architecture to enable airlines and clients around the world to quickly access airline content. By transmitting data through the AWS network rather than the public internet, we boast industry-leading network performance.

What is the booking success rate?

Over the past 15 years of operation, we have enhanced our systems and ensured stability, maintaining reliable operations continuously without any major issues.

How available is HaloSync, and do you offer any uptime guarantees?

With 99.95% high availability, HaloSync ensures reliable and uninterrupted service operations.

Can we monitor or control issues with airlines?

Yes, this can be checked through the dashboard of Albus(Platform Control & Admin). Critical errors will be communicated separately to clients.

Is it possible to track overall sales, not limited to NDC content provided by HaloSync?

If you have a separate back-office system, it is expected that you can integrate it with PolarHub API to view your total sales. For more details, please contact us separately.

Do I use Luna(B2B Portal Service) or will I have to use airline portal?

You can manage all airline information through Luna(B2B Portal Service) without the need to use the airline portals.

In case technology goes down, how will you contact us? What if we lose business?

ince we monitor the system 24/7, the likelihood of serious issues such as system outages is very low. In the unlikely event of a critical failure, we will send an alert to clients immediately and continuously share updates on the situation. Additionally, issues can be reported via ATS Jira or email.

How is technical support provided?

Please submit technical support issues via ATS Jira or email, and we will respond promptly. Critical errors and urgent issues are supported even during nights/weekends.

What happens when an airline or IATA upgrades their schema? How long will it take for Halo&Co to also upgrade? Will there be a difference in service?

Halo&Co has been operating HaloSync services for years and has developed to respond to IATA upgrades. We have established a fast and reliable deployment system, ensuring uninterrupted deployment even when incorporating IATA upgrades.
